description: This file contains configuration handling logic for connecting to a MongoDB database, including data classes, validation functions, JSON loading, and a public interface to load settings from file or environment variables.

classes.name: MongoSettings
classes.description: Immutable data class that holds MongoDB connection parameters: uri, database, and collection.

methods.name: None _validate_mongo_uri(uri: str)
methods.description: Validates that the MongoDB URI is a non-empty string and starts with 'mongodb://' or 'mongodb+srv://'.

methods.name: None _validate_non_empty(name: str, value: str)
methods.description: Ensures that a given string value is non-empty, used to validate database and collection names.

methods.name: dict _load_json_file(path: str)
methods.description: Loads a JSON file from a specified path and returns its contents as a dictionary, raises error if JSON is invalid.

methods.name: MongoSettings _from_dict(cfg: dict)
methods.description: Constructs a MongoSettings object from a dictionary with validation of required fields.

methods.name: MongoSettings load_mongo_settings()
methods.description: Public function to load MongoDB settings from a config file or environment variables, with fallback logic and detailed error messages.
